title: Arsenal transfer news: Jack Wilshere could join Man City, says Xavi | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 3:11 pm Pep Guardiola is a big fan of Jack Wilshere (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere looks a likely summer transfer target for Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola , according to his former player Xavi. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The England international, currently on loan at fellow Premier League side Bournemouth, has had his injury problems down the years, though finally seems to be regaining his best fitness and form. 
Guardiola knows Wilshere well from when he put in a superb performance for Arsenal to beat his Barcelona side back in 2011, and Xavi claims the Spanish tactician has been following him ever since. Wilshere has impressed on loan at Bournemouth (Picture: Getty) 
Speaking about a possible move to bring Wilshere to City this summer, Xavi believes his old boss is likely to be considering it. 
‘I know Pep has always had a lot of respect for Wilshere – he impressed so many of the Barcelona team when we played Arsenal in 2011,’ Xavi told Fox Latin America.
